intro: Dasystephana parryi, commonly known as the Parry's dasystephana, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Dasystephana parryi is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
